column4: I have a bunch of accounts with the group 'students'. I want to provide a person with read-only access to their home directories, but I don't want people in 'students' to be able to view each others home directories. Is there any way to do this?
you'll probably have to resort to ACLs
I'm assuming you don't want to create some new group, give the group ownership to all of those student's homes and then add that one person to that group
I never found any good documentation, « man setfacl » and « man getfacl ».  They're not that difficult.  Note you have to remount the partition with the acl option
I think I'll look in that direction. That seems to be what I need. Thanks.
yes, they definitely give you a lot more control
there's also eiciel (graphical editor for ACLs) that might make it easier to play with ACLs at first
Thanks. Looks like something I don't want to just throw into a live environment though.
well, I'd get comfortable with them first, but for something simple like you are doing, there's not much to worry about
